title: NFL minicamp 2025 live updates: Saquon Barkley refreshed, ready to run it back
content: The majority of NFL mandatory minicamps are in action this week. Our reporters have the latest from around the league.

title: Rodgers: Joining Tomlin, Steelers 'best for soul'
content: Aaron Rodgers called continuing his playing career with the Steelers a decision that was "best for my soul," and noted that coach Mike Tomlin was the biggest draw when it came to picking Pittsburgh.

title: Sources: Knicks' request for Udoka, Finch denied
content: The Knicks requested permission to speak to Timberwolves coach Chris Finch and Rockets coach Ime Udoka, but were denied on both, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Hard tag reignites Chisholm's feud with Garcia
content: The bad blood between the Yankees' Jazz Chisholm and the Royals' Maikel Garcia resurfaced Tuesday night when Chisholm left with a sore neck after an attempted tag from Garcia.

title: Top prospect Anthony's family cheers 1st MLB hit
content: It was a special day for the Red Sox's Roman Anthony, the No. 1 prospect in baseball who hit a two-run double and made a sliding catch with his family on hand at Fenway Park on Tuesday night in a 3-1 win over the Rays.

title: Switzerland routs U.S. in Gold Cup sendoff loss
content: The United States gave up four goals in the first half and looked unprepared for next year's World Cup, getting routed by Switzerland 4-0 in a friendly on Tuesday in Nashville, losing its fourth straight game for the first time since 2007.

title: Bolts' Harbaugh had cardiac ablation, hip surgery
content: Chargers coach Jim Harbaugh said Tuesday that he had a successful cardiac ablation and offseason hip replacement surgery.

title: Baker: Settlement helps NCAA avoid 'bankruptcy'
content: NCAA president Charlie Baker framed the multibillion-dollar House settlement agreement as one that provides stability to college athletics and avoids "bankruptcy."

title: WR Adams: Joining Rams 'exactly what I needed'
content: Davante Adams has only been in Los Angeles for one offseason, but the new Rams wide receiver said he feels "rejuvenated" compared to his last few NFL seasons.

title: What all 30 MLB teams must do before the trade deadline
content: Is your team going to make a midsummer splash? Here's how the next few weeks could decide the season.

title: Still-too-early MLB All-Stars: Roster predictions, biggest debates
content: Freddie Freeman vs. Pete Alonso? Tarik Skubal vs. Kris Bubic? Here's our look at who will make it to Atlanta.

title: Forget the World Cup, USMNT doesn't look ready for the Gold Cup
content: Tuesday's capitulation will no doubt leave Mauricio Pochettino wondering what he has gotten himself into.

title: Our latest NBA mock draft: Back-and-forth on team need vs. best value
content: Best player available? Fill a need? We played out both strategies for 30 first-round slots in the draft.

title: 2025 NBA Finals: NBA experts debate Thunder-Pacers Game 3 storylines, what's next
content: The Thunder evened the series on Sunday with a win over the Pacers. Here's what to watch heading into Game 3.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Storm bounce back while Sky fall in Week 4 edition
content: Seattle returns to the top three while Chicago tumbles as the middle of the league finds its footing.

title: 'It's not a fair fight': Looking back at Tiger's historic 2000 U.S. Open championship
content: Woods arrived at Pebble Beach playing great golf and proceeded to lap the field, winning by 15 strokes. We look back at some of the highlights from one of the most dominant major performances in history.

title: Parenting and game plans: Inside Jenny Boucek's extraordinary basketball journey to the Pacers
content: For decades, Boucek had professional dreams and personal ones -- and believed they were mutually exclusive. Now, as a mom and the first front-of-the-bench female assistant in the NBA, she's finally living both.

title: Yamal has the mentality of Messi, Ronaldo. He'll be even better in 2025-26
content: Lamine Yamal may have fallen short in the Champions League and Nations League, but that will only motivate the Barcelona and Spain star to get better.

title: Spalletti is out as Italy manager, and it's better late than never
content: It was clear after Euro 2024 that a coaching change was needed. After more dire displays, it finally came.

title: Tuchel: England 'frozen' in historic loss to Senegal
content: Thomas Tuchel admitted England were "frozen" in their 3-1 friendly defeat to Senegal but insisted there was no cause for panic ahead of next year's World Cup.

title: Hayes giving overworked U.S. stars summer break
content: United States coach Emma Hayes told ESPN she will call up a roster composed almost exclusively of domestic players for the team's training camp later this month to allow European-based players to rest after a long club season.

title: Mexico edges Turkey 1-0 in Gold Cup tune-up
content: Mexico wrapped up its 2025 Gold Cup preparations with a 1-0 friendly victory over Turkey on Tuesday night.

title: Alexis asks for forgiveness as Chile miss '26 WC
content: Chile will miss their third straight World Cup after losing 2-0 at Bolívia on Tuesday to remain last in South America's 10-team round-robin competition.

title: Sources: Wave's Sánchez in talks for Tigres return
content: San Diego Wave winger and Mexico international Maria Sanchez is currently in "very advanced" negotiations with Liga MX Femenil's Tigres, sources have told ESPN.

title: Mexico changes LA hotels over safety concerns
content: Mexico will change hotels in Los Angeles ahead of their Gold Cup match because of safety concerns amid the protests against immigration raids, a source told ESPN.

title: From Kick-Six to the Lamar Leap: The top 25 college football plays of the millennium
content: Ahead of the 2025 season, our writers voted on the most significant and wildest plays of the past 25 years.

title: Feel F1 performance for yourself: Take home Red Bull's RB17 for $6.7m
content: If you have $6.7 million to spare, you can experience F1 speeds yourself, with Red Bull's RB17 offering mind-bending performance to the public.

title: Daniel Suárez sees global potential as he leads NASCAR into Mexico
content: Suárez returns to race in Mexico for the first time in a decade, and he thinks this is just the beginning of NASCAR's world tour.

title: Divisional rankings: Nakatani, Opetaia win by KO, top their divisions
content: Junto Nakatani and Jai Opetaia won again, while Abdullah mason got closer to the top 10 at lightweight. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: UFC 316 clears the way for much-anticipated bantamweight showdowns
content: Two blockbuster fights seem imminent for the UFC 316 main card winners, while next steps for the losers are murkier.

title: Kate Martin has arrived, Odyssey Sims thriving
content: Kate Martin has become a key scoring specialist for the Valkyries that could prove rewarding in fantasy while Odyssey Sims continues to break out in Los Angeles.

title: Reliever stock watch: Giant value in San Francisco's pen
content: Everything fantasy baseball managers need to know about which closers should be added, dropped and more.

title: Stanley Cup Final odds: Bennett overtakes McDavid as Conn Smythe fave
content: Top ways to bet the series and props for the Stanley Cup Final between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool close in on Wirtz
content: Liverpool have reportedly broken their club record to sign Bayer Leverkusen attacking midfielder Florian Wirtz. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: India fertility rate down: Educated middle class in Delhi, Kerala, TN put off childbirth
content: A UN report reveals India's declining fertility rate alongside barriers to reproductive freedom, creating a "high-low duality." While some states grapple with unintended pregnancies due to limited access and gender norms, others face below-replacement fertility driven by financial constraints and work-life conflicts. The focus should shift to fulfilling reproductive goals by empowering individuals to make informed choices.

title: 'If you ever get me married ... ': Sonam’s chilling threat to mother before marriage
content: Vipin, brother of Raja Raghuvanshi, reveals Sonam orchestrated Raja's murder, with her own brother Govind denouncing her actions and demanding severe punishment. Allegations extend to Sonam's mother, accused of prior knowledge. Police investigations uncover pre-marriage planning, including scouting locations and carrying weapons, revealing a calculated plot driven by Sonam's desire to marry Raja.

title: SP neta garlanded, then slapped on dais at public function in UP's Jaunpur
content: At an event commemorating Maharaja Suheldev's birth anniversary in Jaunpur, Mahendra Rajbhar, a senior politician, was assaulted by Brajesh Rajbhar of the Suheldev Swabhiman Party. The incident occurred after Brajesh garlanded Mahendra, leading to condemnation from Akhilesh Yadav, who alleged BJP's involvement. Police have initiated an investigation following a complaint implicating SBSP chief Om Prakash Rajbhar.

title: 'World needs more young angry women': Greta slams Trump after 'anger management' remark
content: Climate activist Greta Thunberg rebuked Donald Trump after he mocked her detention by Israeli forces during a Gaza aid mission. Trump called her a "strange, angry person" and suggested anger management. Thunberg retorted that the world needs "more angry young women," highlighting the suffering in Gaza.

title: IND vs ENG: From Lions to Lord's? Teen pacer joins England squad after Rahul scalp
content: Teenage fast bowler Eddie Jack has been called up to practice with the senior England team before the first Test against India, scheduled for June 20 at Headingley. The 19-year-old impressed during the England Lions' match against India A, taking key wickets. His inclusion comes as England deals with a number of injuries to key fast bowlers.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: There’s a new programming language. It is called…
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently highlighted AI's transformative potential, stating it democratizes programming by enabling users to instruct computers using natural language. He likened programming AI to guiding a person, emphasizing the ease with which AI can now perform complex tasks like writing poems.

title: Israel-Gaza conflict: 36 killed in gunfire while waiting for aid; 200 injured
content: At least 36 Palestinians were killed and over 200 wounded while seeking aid in Gaza, amid ongoing violence and a worsening humanitarian crisis. Israeli forces reportedly opened fire near aid sites. The UN has criticized the new aid system, while ceasefire talks progress. Nearly 55,000 Palestinians have died since the war began, according to Gaza’s health ministry.

title: 'Folks - your Test captain': Gill's first photoshoot as Team India skipper - see pics
content: Shubman Gill, 25, has officially commenced his tenure as India's Test captain with a photoshoot in England, signaling a new era post-Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. The BCCI celebrated Gill's appointment, highlighting his poise and confidence. Gill is preparing rigorously, facing India's top bowlers.

title: Tesla backlash: Dream11 CEO slams cancelled booking; Says Elon Musk is turning Indian fans into haters
content: Dream11 CEO Harsh Jain has criticized Tesla and Elon Musk for refunding his $1,000 Model 3 reservation fee from March 2017. Jain expressed disappointment on X, stating that Tesla is alienating its early Indian supporters by taking away his priority slot after nearly a decade.

title: Trump’s tariffs to stay - for now! US court extends reprieve
content: A US federal appeals court has temporarily upheld President Trump's global tariffs while it reviews the case on an expedited schedule. This decision provides temporary relief to the Trump administration, which is contesting a lower court's ruling that had blocked the broad tariff measures.

title: 'Your wife is Indian' - US rep Brandon Gill trolled for anti-immigrants post
content: Texas Representative Brandon Gill faced online criticism after posting about mass migration and comparing past and present California. Users highlighted the irony, given his wife, Danielle D'Souza, is an immigrant from Mumbai. This incident follows previous controversy where Gill criticised a volleyball tournament, raising concerns about importing foreign class systems.

title: WTC Final: Unbeaten streaks on the line as South Africa face Australia
content: The World Test Championship final at Lord's sets the stage for a clash between South Africa and Australia, where one team's unbeaten streak will be broken. South Africa aims to overcome their 'chokers' tag, while Australia seeks to add another major title to their impressive collection.

title: Buying an iPhone in Dubai vs in India: Majorprosandcons; cost savings yes, but ...
content: For Indian Apple enthusiasts, purchasing the iPhone 16 in Dubai presents a mixed bag. While Pro models offer potential cost savings, non-Pro versions might be pricier. Buying in Dubai means missing out on Indian bank offers and exchange discounts. FaceTime restrictions and potential import duties also need consideration, impacting the overall value proposition.

title: Lawrence Bishnoi’s TV interview filmed inside CIA office: 7 cops suspended; DSP dismissed
content: A special investigation team has found lapses in the security arrangements for gangster Lawrence Bishnoi. The report reveals unauthorized access and protocol breaches during his custody. Several police officials faced suspension and termination. The SIT note highlights failures at multiple levels. It also points to systemic issues within the Anti-Gangster Task Force. The report recommends action against those responsible.

title: LA protests: Photos show National Guard sleeping on floors
content: California Governor Gavin Newsom has accused President Trump of disrespecting National Guard troops deployed to Los Angeles amid immigration protests, citing inadequate conditions and a politically motivated deployment. Newsom filed a lawsuit, alleging Trump exceeded his authority, while Trump suggested Newsom should be arrested for defiance. The Pentagon defended the operation, hinting at future militarized homeland approaches.

title: When love kills: Meghalaya honeymoon murder joins India’s growing list of deadly affairs
content: A series of  murders across India reveal the dark side of relationships, driven by betrayal and revenge. From Meghalaya to Bengaluru, cases involve spouses and lovers resorting to extreme violence, including poisoning, stabbing, and dismemberment.

title: Brooklyn terror plot: Pak citizen extradited to US over plan to attack Jewish center
content: Muhammad Shahzeb Khan, a Pakistani citizen residing in Canada, has been extradited to the U.S. to face terrorism charges. He is accused of plotting a mass shooting at a Jewish center in Brooklyn, intending to carry out the attack on the anniversary of the Hamas assault on Israel in support of the Islamic State.

title: WTC Final: What happens if Aus vs SA ends in a draw? Is there a reserve day?
content: Australia and South Africa are set to clash in the World Test Championship Final at Lord's, with the mace to be shared in case of a draw. A reserve day is in place to recover lost time. The winners will receive USD $3.6 million, while the runners-up get USD $2.16 million.

title: APPSC Group 1 Mains 2025 Results: Scorecards released; download link, toppers, and more
content: The Andhra Pradesh Public Service Commission has released the APPSC Group 1 Mains Result 2025 on its official website, shortlisting 182 candidates for the interview round scheduled from June 23 to 30 in Vijayawada. The exam included seven papers, of which five were merit-based. Candidates can download the result PDF from psc.ap.gov.in.

title: After LA, Chicago erupts in protest over immigration raids - watch video
content: Chicago joined a nationwide wave of protests against Trump administration's immigration raids, as over 1,000 demonstrators rallied in the Loop. Protesters marched through downtown, disrupting traffic and demanding an end to deportations. Similar demonstrations are occurring in cities like New York and San Francisco, reflecting growing national anger over immigration enforcement and military involvement.

title: Chips and cola in hands, labourer holds 4 sons on tracks till train crushes them
content: While leaving home near Subhash Colony around 12.15pm, Manoj — originally from Bihar — told his wife Priya that he was taking the kids to a nearby park to play. Instead, he took them to the tracks and sat under Elson Chowk flyover for about an hour, waiting for the train to arrive. He bought chips and soft drinks for the kids.

title: Gold prices may see limited gains today. Is it time to buy silver?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to see limited upside due to easing US-China trade tensions and steady US macro cues. Analysts suggest selling opportunities around $3360-3390 per oz. Silver, however, is witnessing a breakout and is expected to outperform gold, potentially reaching $38.70 - 41.50 per oz, driven by safe-haven demand and industrial use.

title: 'Come, I am single, hug me': Man kisses 2 women in Bengaluru
content: Bengaluru police apprehended S Madan, 37, for allegedly kissing two women in Pulakeshinagar. The incident occurred on June 6. One victim reported the man accosted and kissed her in Milton Park. He then repeated the act on another woman nearby. Police used CCTV footage to trace Madan to his residence in Banasawadi. He is now in judicial custody.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 above 25,100; BSE Sensex up 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Wednesday. While Nifty50 was above 25,100, BSE Sensex was up around 100 points.

title: 'You can be under-bowled too': Bumrah's workload a concern as India face England
content: As Team India starts its new World Test Championship cycle against England, the focus is on managing Jasprit Bumrah's workload. With senior players retiring, coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Shubman Gill face pressure to preserve Bumrah, who is returning from a back injury. He will play only three Tests, as advised by medical professionals.

title: Trump's YMCA dance: Soldiers cheer and join the US President - watch
content: During a visit to Fort Bragg, Donald Trump celebrated the US Army's birthday while addressing immigration protests in Los Angeles. He praised the military's aggressive response and criticized California's leadership, hinting at further troop deployments. Trump's remarks drew condemnation from Democrats, who viewed the deployment as unconstitutional, while his signature dance moves garnered cheers from the troops.

title: Maharashtra FYJC Class 11 Merit List: Releasing today—how to download, dates & more
content: The School Education and Sports Department, Maharashtra, will release the final merit list for FYJC Class 11 admissions 2025 today, June 11. Postponed from June 8 to allow grievance redressal, the revised schedule supports a transparent process. Over 20 lakh seats across 9,281 colleges are up for grabs in Arts, Science, and Commerce streams.

title: Ax-4 mission delayed: Shukla's ISS launch postponed after SpaceX detects LOx leak
content: SpaceX has postponed the Axiom-4 mission launch to the International Space Station due to a Liquid Oxygen (LOx) leak discovered during post-static fire booster inspections. The launch, which was scheduled for Wednesday at 5:30 pm IST, was delayed to allow SpaceX teams time for repairs. A new launch date will be announced pending the completion of repairs and range availability.

title: Govind Namdev on dating rumours with Shivangi Verma: ‘She went ahead..'; Exclusive
content: Veteran actor Govind Namdev has finally addressed the dating rumours swirling around him and actress Shivangi Verma after a photograph of the two together went viral. In an exclusive conversation with ETimes, the 70-year-old actor set the record straight, revealing that the photo in question was part of a professional publicity strategy for their upcoming film Gaurishankar Goharganj Wale.

title: 'Book your climax wisely': UP Police's ‘Housefull 5’ safety post
content: Uttar Pradesh Police's road safety campaign on X went viral, creatively referencing Bollywood's Housefull 5. The post presented riders with two outcomes: one with a helmet, unharmed, and another injured without. The tagline, "Book Your Climax Wisely," urged responsible choices. DGP Rajeev Krishna initiated the campaign, garnering over 1.22 lakh views.

title: 'Same playbook': Vivek Ramaswamy likens Newsom to George Wallace
content: Vivek Ramaswamy has ignited controversy by comparing Gavin Newsom to George Wallace, criticizing Newsom's opposition to federal immigration enforcement. Ramaswamy accuses Newsom of mirroring Wallace's defiance of federal authority, particularly regarding desegregation versus deportation policies. This comparison comes amid a clash between the White House and California over immigration enforcement, with Ramaswamy suggesting Newsom's actions are politically motivated.

title: FIFA WCQ Qualifiers: Brazil qualify for next year's World Cup; Ancelotti picks first win
content: Brazil clinched their spot in the 2026 FIFA World Cup with a narrow 1-0 victory against Paraguay, marking Carlo Ancelotti's debut win. Vinicius Jr.'s goal just before halftime secured the win, propelling Brazil to third place in the South American standings. Paraguay, despite the loss, remains in contention for qualification, needing only a point to secure their place.

title: WTC Final: Cummins backs Labuschagne as opener, explains Boland omission
content: Australia have announced a surprising lineup for the World Test Championship Final, with Marnus Labuschagne opening alongside Usman Khawaja. Josh Hazlewood gets the nod over Scott Boland in a tough fast bowling decision. Cameron Green returns from injury, while Beau Webster provides all-round support as Australia aims for victory at Lord's.

title: 'Local emergency': Mayor Bass declares curfew in downtown LA amid anti-ICE protests
content: Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass declared a local emergency and imposed a curfew in downtown LA following five days of protests against federal immigration raids. The curfew, spanning from 8 PM to 6 AM, aims to curb vandalism and looting, with exemptions for residents, workers, media, and the homeless.

title: Magic Johnson sounds off: Slams Indiana Pacers’; 'They can’t beat..' — what went wrong
content: Following the Indiana Pacers' Game 2 loss to the Oklahoma City Thunder, Lakers legend Magic Johnson criticized their half-court-focused offense. Johnson urged Tyrese Haliburton to prioritize scoring early and ignite Indiana's transition game. Haliburton acknowledged the Thunder's defensive pressure and vowed to improve. With the series tied, the Pacers return home needing to adjust their strategy to avoid falling behind.

title: Meghalaya horror: Sonam returned to MP post-murder, met lover; cops say ‘trauma act’ to mislead
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi is accused of plotting her husband's murder during their honeymoon in Meghalaya. Police investigations reveal she returned to Indore, met her alleged lover, and then resurfaced in Uttar Pradesh, claiming amnesia. Authorities suspect a calculated escape, citing phone records, travel routes, and her behavior as evidence against her claims of trauma and abduction.

title: US-China trade talks: 'Framework' agreed in London; final sign-off awaits Trump, Xi
content: In a potential breakthrough, the US and China have established a framework to resolve their long-standing trade disputes following discussions in London. US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick announced the agreement, pending presidential approval, expressing optimism about resolving issues like rare earth exports.

title: 'We are politicians, not saints': Ajit Pawar on joining NDA; says no NCP-SP merger
content: Ajit Pawar defended his faction's decision to join the NDA, stating that remaining in opposition was ineffective for addressing public grievances. He emphasized that the NCP's foundation remains rooted in secular ideology, despite aligning with the BJP-led alliance for development. Pawar also dismissed merger rumors with NCP (SP) and warned against anti-social activities by party members.

title: Meghalaya murder case: Accused gets slapped at Indore airport by unknown man
content: The Meghalaya murder case has sparked national outrage after an Indore businessman was allegedly killed during his honeymoon. His wife, Sonam, is implicated, with evidence suggesting her involvement. As the accused were being transported, an unidentified man slapped one of them at Indore airport, highlighting the intense public sentiment surrounding the crime.

title: WTC Final: 'There is an opportunity there' - SA target Australia's weakness
content: South Africa aim to exploit Australia's unfamiliar opening pair of Usman Khawaja and Marnus Labuschagne in the World Test Championship Final at Lord's. Captain Temba Bavuma believes the swinging conditions will favour their bowlers, especially Kagiso Rabada, who is in top form. South Africa hope early wickets will put pressure on Australia's batting lineup in the high-stakes clash.

title: In another step forward, India to host Chinese vice minister for talks
content: Chinese Vice Foreign Minister Sun Weidong is expected to visit India this week, marking the second high-level bilateral exchange this year. Discussions will likely encompass the normalization of relations following the Ladakh standoff, including the resumption of air services and people-to-people exchanges.

title: 'I love leading': Captain Shreyas Iyer and finals - The love story continues
content: Shreyas Iyer continues his impressive captaincy, leading SoBo Mumbai Falcons to the T20 Mumbai League 2025 final, marking his fourth final in just over a year. This golden run includes an IPL triumph with KKR, a Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy title with Mumbai, and leading Punjab Kings to an IPL final.

title: Kelce, Swift seek court protection from stalker; Man claims Swift is mother of his child
content: Travis Kelce has consistently voiced his desire to protect both his relationship with Taylor Swift and her safety. However, Swift recently had to seek legal protection herself, obtaining a restraining order against a Colorado man who repeatedly visited her Los Angeles home, falsely claiming she is the mother of his child.

title: Bullet for ballot: 6 get life for killing man who voted ‘wrongly’
content: An Agra court sentenced six men to life imprisonment for the 2005 murder of Dharampal Singh, who refused to vote for their preferred candidate in the panchayat elections. The victim and his brother were attacked after declining to support the accused's nominee, leading to Dharampal's death.

title: 3rd T20I: Duckett blasts England to series sweep; beat West Indies by 37 runs
content: England dominated West Indies with a 37-run victory, completing a 3-0 T20I series sweep in Southampton. Ben Duckett's explosive 84 and Jamie Smith's quickfire 60 powered England to 248/3, their joint-highest T20I score at home. Despite Rovman Powell's valiant 79*, West Indies fell short at 211/8, with Luke Wood's 3-31 leading England's disciplined bowling attack.

title: 'Housefull 5' crosses Rs 110 crore; earns Rs 10.75 crore on Tuesday at box office
content: Akshay Kumar's 'Housefull 5' marks his return to comedy, captivating audiences and achieving box office success. Directed by Tarun Mansukhani, the film earned ₹111.25 crore in India within five days. 'Housefull 5' presents a unique storyline involving a murder mystery on a cruise ship, featuring three characters named Jolly, portrayed by Akshay Kumar, Riteish Deshmukh, and Abhishek Bachchan.

title: Raincoat, 'Khukri', And Blood: New Details In Sonam Raghuvanshi Case
content: New details have emerged in the murder of Indore's Raja Raghuvanshi, whose decomposed body was recovered from a gorge in Meghalaya on June 2. Raja's wife, Sonam Raghuvanshi, and her alleged boyfriend, Raj Kushwaha, are suspected to be the masterminds

title: PM Modi Pays Tribute To Sant Kabir Das On His Birth Anniversary
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday paid tribute to mystic poet and saint Kabir Das on his birth anniversary, and said his contribution in removing the evils prevalent in the society will always be remembered with reverence.

title: "Will Shock Political Establishment": Indian Origin NYC Mayoral Candidate Zohran Mamdani
content: Indian-origin New York State Assemblyman Zohran Mamdani has come within striking distance of ex-governor Andrew Cuomo in the New York City mayoral race, newly released polling data showed.

title: Father Holds 4 Sons On Tracks As They Scream, Train Kills Them All
content: A 45-year old man along with his four children committed suicide by jumping in front of a train in Faridabad on Tuesday, police said.

title: TruAlt Bioenergy, An Ethanol Producer, Gets Oil Marketing Company Status
content: TruAlt Bioenergy Limited is one of India's largest biofuel producers, playing a pivotal role in the country's transition toward clean and sustainable energy.

title: Constitution Is A "Quiet Revolution" Uplifting Oppressed: Chief Justice
content: Chief Justice of India (CJI) B R Gavai has described the Constitution as a "quiet revolution etched in ink" and a transformative force that not only guarantees rights but actively uplifts the historically oppressed.

title: Honeymoon Murder Updates: Sonam Raghuvanshi, Other Accused Brought To Shillong
content: Honeymoon murder: On the night of June 7, officials found Sonam in an unconscious state at a 'dhaba' in Ghazipur, where she later surrendered to killing her husband, Raja Raghuvanshi.

title: Police Officials Exhibit Apathy In Kidnapping Cases: Allahabad High Court
content: The Allahabad High Court slams police officials for apathy in abduction/kidnapping cases, as no personal responsibility is fixed upon the officers. It was observed while dealing with complain filed by Nitesh Kumar regarding his missing brother.

title: Probe Agency Raids Congress Bellary MP, 3 MLAs In Karnataka Valmiki Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate on Wednesday conducted searches against Congress' Bellary MP E Tukaram and three MLAs in Karnataka as part of a money laundering probe into the alleged Valmiki scam, official sources said.

title: Pakistani Man Who Allegedly Plotted US Attack Extradited From Canada
content: A Pakistani man was extradited from Canada to the United States on Tuesday to face charges of plotting to carry out an attack on Jews in New York City, the Justice Department said.

title: "Good Decision As Humans Involved": ISRO Chief To NDTV After Axiom Launch Delayed
content: ISRO played a big role in making sure the launch is postponed till the oxygen leak is fixed on the SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket.

title: "900,000 Illegal Migrants": What Makes LA Hotbed For Immigrant Protests
content: Why has Los Angeles, home to some of America's wealthiest and most powerful people, become the hotbed for US President Donald Trump's strictest immigration crackdown over the weekend? The answer lies in the city's ethnic, and demographic makeup.

title: "Will Marry Raja Raghuvanshi But...": Sonam's Threat To Mother Before Wedding
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi was in love with Raj Kushwaha and had warned her family of "consequences" if she was pressured to marry Raja Raghuvanshi, who was brutally murdered days after he married the woman, police sources said.

title: Same Murder, Different Routes: How Sonam, Killers Escaped From Meghalaya
content: The murder occurred on May 23, the body was found on June 2, and the whereabouts of the wife were unknown. There was speculation that the woman, who had come with her husband for her honeymoon, may have also been attacked or kidnapped.

title: BRS Family Feud In Spotlight As KCR To Appear Before Inquiry Commission
content: All eyes will be on the Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) first family even as the patriarch, former Chief Minister K Chandrashekhar Rao, will appear before the PC Ghose Commission of Inquiry today.

title: Wife Behind Murder Of Indore Man In Meghalaya, She Surrenders In UP
content: The newlywed couple, Raja Raghuvanshi and his wife Sonam, visited some areas during their honeymoon in Meghalaya before they went missing on May 23.

title: Axiom Launch To Send Shubhanshu Shukla To Space Deferred For Rocket Repair
content: The launch of the Axiom-4 mission that will carry India's second astronaut to space was postponed for a fifth time on Wednesday.

title: What Is Meta's 'Superintelligence' That Zuckerberg Is Hiring Personally For
content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is taking a hands-on approach to one of tech's most ambitious frontiers: building artificial general intelligence (AGI).

title: Man Accused Of Rape-Murder Of 9-Year-Old Arrested After Encounter: Delhi Cops
content: Days after alleged rape and murder of a nine-year-old girl in northeast Delhi's Dayalpur area, a 28-year-old man was arrested on Tuesday after an encounter with police, an official said.

title: Sonam Raghuvanshi Brought To Shillong, To Be Produced In Court Today
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi, the prime accused in the murder of her husband Raja Raghuvanshi, was brought to Shillong overnight. She is in a three-day transit remand with the Meghalaya Police.

title: NBA Finals betting: Thunder huge title favorites after blowout win
content: Oklahoma City Thunder beat the Indiana Pacers 123-107 in game 2 . the Thunder moved from -325 to -550 to win the title while the Pacers dropped down from +260 to +400 . in the finals MVP race, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander (-550) is still the favorite by a wide margin .

title: Our final college softball rankings: How do the top 25 teams stack up after the WCWS?
content: the 2025 college softball season is over, with the longhorns taking home their first national title . here is the final ESPN.com/USA Softball Collegiate top 25 ranking . the rankings are based on each team's final record .

title: The field of 8 is set: NCAA baseball tournament schedule, results
content: the field for the men's college world series in Omaha, Nebraska, is set . it'll be the Racers' first time in Omaha . four teams are making their first appearances in Omaha since winning the title the last time they made it this far .

title: Ancelotti's first Brazil win seals World Cup spot
content: brazil qualify for the 2026 world cup with a 1-0 win over Paraguay . the win was the first for new manager Carlo Ancelotti . real madrid striker Vincius Jnior scored the game's only goal in the second half .

title: 💍 Surprise! Aaron Rodgers reveals he's married
content: a ring on his finger drew questions as to what the ring was . "it's a wedding ring," rodgers tells reporters . he's been married for a couple of months but has yet to confirm the identity of his wife .

title: Answering one big question for seven QBs entering Year 2
content: the 2024 wide receiver class is a good time to go back to last year's rookies . it is not an exaggeration to consider this class, which also includes Drake Maye and Bo Nix in the top 12 picks, on par with the 2018 class that delivered Josh Allen, Lamar Jackson, and Baker Mayfield .

title: Overheard at the NHL draft combine: Draft wild cards, surprises ... and the X factor team
content: scouts and executives alike marveled at what could be an unpredictable first round . the upcoming draft is expected to be announced on july 27 and 28 . "there are maybe 16 or 18 players I could see going in the top 10," says one .

title: U.S. Open tiers: Ranking every player in the field at Oakmont
content: scouting reports of the revamped course outside Pittsburgh have included descriptions of "carnage," "cooked beyond belief" and the "hardest course in the world" Xander Schauffele: "it's the hardest course they've ever played"

title: In search of Chilika’s Irrawaddy dolphins
content: We set out at dawn on a boat from Rambha in Odisha’s Chilika lake, hoping to catch a glimpse of the elusive Irrawaddy dolphin. Do we get lucky?

title: Farmers seek early implementation of Kalasa Banduri Nala project in Karnataka
content: They allege that some vested interests are trying to stop the project, which is meant for providing drinking water to people

title: C. V. Raman hospital ties up with NGO to provide geriatric and palliative care closer to home in Bengaluru
content: As part of the collaboration, a 12-bed ward including six-beds for female patients has been set aside in the hospital

title: Rahul writes to PM, flags delay in scholarships for students from marginalised communities
content: In his letter to PM Modi, Rahul Gandhi urged the PM to resolve these two critical issues, which he said hinder education opportunities for the 90% of students who are from marginalised communities.

title: Eight IPS officers in Chhattisgarh get new postings for anti-Maoist operations
content: Chhattisgarh Government deploys eight IPS officers for anti-Maoist operations following ASP Girepunje ’s death in IED blast

title: Singapore-flagged cargo ship fire: 40% of blaze in forward bay contained but vessel continues to emit heavy smoke
content: Firefighting efforts progressing and no structural compromise of ship has been reported. But thermal and gas risks near affected compartments exist

title: Rajasthan received ₹2,11,000 crore from Centre since 2014: Bhajan Lal Sharma
content: He described the last 11 years of the Modi govt as an era of “all-round performance” in every sphere of governance

title: India’s rapidly expanding infrastructure network boosting ‘Ease of Living’: PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister celebrates 11 years of “infrastructure revolution”, emphasising how it boosts ‘Ease of Living’ and prosperity in India

title: Security forces conduct search operations after suspicious movement in J&K’s Samba
content: Accordinng to officials, villagers reportedly noticed the suspected persons wearing combat uniforms near a school in the vicinity of Nud village

title: Demolition drive launched in Delhi's Bhoomiheen camp
content: We have deployed adequate police force, along with paramilitary forces, to carry out the demolition peacefully. No one will be allowed to breach law and order, noted an official

title: Raichur MP for parliamentary debate on Pahalgam attack, Operation Sindoor
content: Union Ministers, political leaders, officials and even international dignitaries made public statements about the attack and India’s response, but there is no discussion in Parliament, says G. Kumar Naik

title: Jayant Patil indicates resignation as NCP(SP) Maharashtra chief
content: The announcement came during an event at Pune’s Balgandharva Auditorium, where party patriarch and former Union Minister Sharad Pawar was present on the dais. “Pawar Saheb gave me immense opportunities and I’ve carried this responsibility for seven years. Now, the party must make way for new leadership,” Mr. Patil stated

title: Two journalists arrested in Noida over blackmail, extortion charges
content: Authorities have said that the accused were involved in blackmailing a news channel's management for crores of rupees.

title: J&K’s ‘dual control’ leading to disconnect with people, says  Congress leader Tariq Hameed Karra
content: ‘We will continue to fight vigorously for the Statehood and safeguarding rights of our people, says J&K Congress chief Tariq Hameed Karra

title: Valmiki scam case: ED searches underway in Ballari MP, 2 Karnataka MLAs’ premises
content: The raids targeted the homes of Lok Sabha member from Ballari E. Tukaram, Ballari City MLA Nara Bharat Reddy, Kampli MLA J.N. Ganesh, and Ballari Rural MLA B. Nagendra’s close associate Govardhan Reddy

title: Kaleshwaram project’s engineer Nune Sridhar booked, ACB initiates searches in 12 locations
content: A case of disproportionate assets has been booked against the former official  in connection with the alleged irregularities in the execution of the Kaleshwaram lift irrigation project.

title: Police officials exhibit apathy in kidnapping cases: Allahabad HC
content: The court directed the State government to file its reply in the matter and also sought a personal affidavit from the Commissioner of Police, Varanasi, on or before June 12, showing cause why the abductee has not been recovered so far

title: FS Misri meets UAE Minister to review 'growing' bilateral partnership
content: The two met for the "Mid-Year Review of the growing and expanding India-UAE Comprehensive Strategic Partnership

title: Kochi police file case over display of Pakistan flag at pastoral prayer meet
content: Pastor booked. Case registered on a complaint lodged by a BJP activist who was alerted through social media about use of Pakistan flag

title: Family alleges assault by toll plaza staff in Kannur
content: It is learnt that Aziz honked his car horn, prompting a violent reaction from the toll plaza staff. The family alleged that the guard physically assaulted them without any provocation.

title: Honeymoon horror: 'Prime accused Sonam came to Indore after husband's murder and stayed in flat'
content: According to police, Raj Kushwaha, who allegedly plotted the murder of Raja Raghuvanshi with Sonam during their honeymoon in Meghalaya was her suspected boyfriend

title: AAP opposes proposed fee regulation bill, calls  it 'anti-parent'
content: The AAP Legislative Group has formally demanded that the BJP government convene a Special Session of the Delhi Assembly to introduce the Fee Regulation Bill

title: Standing down from Falcon 9’s launch of Ax-4, says SpaceX, and more in today’s top news: LIVE updates
content: The mission was supposed to carry Indian astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla’s to the International Space Station, and more in today’s top news

title: By 2030 Mumbai, Delhi, Chennai and five other cities to experience two-fold increase in heatwave days
content: A study by IPE Global and Esri India reveals that by 2030, climate change is expected to drive 43% rise in the intensity of extreme rainfall events across India, making the country hotter and wetter.

title: Goa doctors call off the State-wide strike and protest against State Health Minister
content: At a meeting held late in the Tuesday evening with the GMCH Dean Dr. Shivanand M. Bandekar, medical superintendent Dr. Rajesh T. Patil, members of GARD and doctors from GMCH, the Goa Chief Minister requested doctors to withdraw their strike and assured no repercussion or action will be false against any doctors due to the incident.

title: Karnataka identifies six high-potential areas to create 20 lakh new jobs and attract investment of ₹7.5 lakh crore in five years
content: The six priority areas identified are aerospace and defence; electronics and semiconductors; capital goods and robotics; auto and electric vehicles; technical and MMF-based textiles, and consumer products

title: Probing case of ‘kidnap and wrongful confinement’ of pet cat proves costly for Bengaluru city police
content: Karnataka High Court admonishes police for entertaining complaint and filing chargesheet when complaint does not even indicate any non-cognisable offence

title: Sri Lankan refugees of 1990: A dark chapter in T.N.’s otherwise proud history of offering sanctuary to those in need
content: Two ships, Harsh Vardhana and Tippu Sultan, carrying about 1,250 Sri Lankan refugees, were not permitted for disembarkation of passengers at what was then known as the Madras harbour, on March 8 and 9, 1990

title: Frederick Forsyth’s The Day of the Jackal: A rite of passage for the yesteryear readers of Madras
content: For many readers in the Madras of the past, an essential rite of passage was to read Forsyth’s masterpiece The Day of the Jackal

title: Andhra Pradesh government constitutes task force to identify economic growth avenues
content: Chaired by Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu, the task force will point out  infra gaps, assess capital requirements, evaluate policy framework and suggest reforms

title: 'India ain't football you kick around': Ex-Pentagon official Rubin on ties with Canada
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Sharmila accuses Sajjala of making derogatory remarks against women
content: Alleging that the YSRCP leader equated women to demons and devils, the APCC president calls it highly objectionable

title: India has progressed on all fronts under Modi’s rule, says Union Minister
content: Kishan Reddy said in 2014, when PM Modi assumed office, India was 10th largest economy with a GDP of $2.1 trillion and now it has emerged as a $4 trillion economy

title: A Chennai man’s honeymoon murder in Munnar and striking parallels to the Meghalaya case
content: Back in 2006, few would have imagined that this sensational case in Munnar would find eerie echoes 19 years later in Meghalaya, where Raja Raghuvanshi, a man from Indore, was murdered during his honeymoon — a plot allegedly hatched by his wife, Sonam.

title: Highlighting 11 years of Modi govt., BJP attacks TMC govt.
content: BJP legislators and Union Ministers Bhupendra Yadav and Sukanta Majumdar express confidence in the BJP forming the government in West Bengal following Assembly elections in 2026 and say it will “restore the State’s legacy and glory”.

title: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs to move out of Nirman Bhawan by end of June
content: Nirman Bhawan also houses offices of the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare; an office memorandum says the new building will be equipped with basic office infrastructure including furniture, NIC connectivity, ICT facilities, etc.

title: Probation must be pillar of juvenile justice, say experts
content: At the national consultation, retired Supreme Court judge and Chairperson of the UN Internal Justice Council, Justice Madan B. Lokur lamented the neglect of probation in India’s juvenile justice system

title: Telangana Health Minister orders free treatment for toddler after parents die in road accident
content: According to doctors, the three-and-a-half-year-old girl has sustained a severe spinal injury and requires surgery

title: Science at the core of Vikshit Bharat vision, says Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan at Global Young Scientists Summit
content: He said initiatives like Atal Tinkering Labs and the Anusandhan National Research Foundation Act reflect India’s commitment to nurturing grassroots innovation and supporting high-quality interdisciplinary research

title: No toilet for boys at this school since 1947, until a teacher built urinals from scratch
content: A solution to the issue came from the school’s physical director, Pilli Kashinath, who devised a low-cost innovation by repurposing five-litre plastic oil cans as urinals

title: Scientists uncover molecular clue to slow down reproductive aging
content: The team, using both live mouse models and cultured goat ovaries, found that reducing the activity of a cellular protein called ‘Cathepsin B’ (Cat B) helps preserve the ovarian reserve

title: Tourist activities launched at Shipki-La mountain pass in Himachal’s tribal Kinnaur district bordering China, says CM Sukhu
content: We have eased restrictions for the tourists to enjoy the beauty of Shipki-La and the tourism activities here would strengthen the economy of the local people along with boosting tourism in the region, he said

title: Chhattisgarh bids adieu to police officer killed in IED blast; 7-year-old son lights pyre
content: Girepunje was killed and two more officers were injured when an IED, allegedly planted by the Maoists, exploded near Dondra village in Sukma.

title: BBC report claims at least 82 killed in Maha Kumbh stampedes
content: State government has officially claimed 37 deaths; Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav accuses Uttar Pradesh government of lying about the death toll

title: Consultations to appoint district chiefs begin as Cong. plans revival drive in Haryana
content: Anyone between 35 and 55 years of age and having been an active member of the party for the past five years can apply for the post

title: Central Pollution Control Board to decide on future of flue gas desulphurisation units: Power Minister
content: Flue gas desulphurisation units are an additional piece of equipment retro-fitted in thermal power plants to cut harmful sulphur dioxide emissions resulting from burning coal

title: Vizag metro rail: AIIB team review project
content: The team, led by Senior Investment Officer Mr. Pascal Roussel (from France), studied all the 43 proposed metro rail stations of the first phase, covering a distance of 46.23 km, over the past two days in the city

title: How can Pakistan lead the fight against terror, asks Rajnath
content: Defence Minister questions UN decision to appoint Pakistan as vice-chair of its counter-terrorism committee; says the neighbouring country has sheltered 9/11 mastermind as well as terror organisations

title: Enforcement Directorate files supplementary prosecution complaint in ₹48,000-crore PACL case
content: Harsatinder Pal Singh Hayer allegedly played a key role in the illicit transfer and parking of funds amounting to ₹657.18 crore abroad

title: CPI(M)‘s M.A. Baby tours areas hit by shelling in Kashmir, expresses concern over ‘poor’ compensation
content: ‘The decision to grant ₹1.30 lakh as compensation is very meagre,’ the CPI(M) general secretary said, adding his party MPs would take up the issue of compensation in Parliament ‘very seriously’

title: Haryana police yet to respond to notice over professor’s arrest: NHRC
content: Ashoka University professor Ali Khan Mahmudabad was arrested for his remarks on Operation Sindoor in social media posts

title: Don’t withhold RTE funds over NEP row: Madras High Court to Centre
content: HC Bench says unable to issue a binding direction because T.N. government has already filed a suit before the Supreme Court; insists that Centre and State have concurrent obligations under RTE Act

title: Nitish Kumar has performed the last rites for law and order in Bihar: Lalu Prasad
content: Leaders of the ruling Janata Dal (United) and the Bharatiya Janata Party hit back at Mr. Prasad asking him not to give a sermon on law and order

title: CPI(M-L) likely to contest around 45 seats in Bihar Assembly election
content: Mahagathbandhan ally to launch ‘Badlo Sarkar-Badlo Bihar’ campaign; talks on seat sharing to begin soon

title: IPL stampede: Congress high command ‘reprimands’ CM, Dy. CM
content: Congress high command told both leaders “that there should be a clear-cut pro-people attitude on this issue” to make over the dented image of the government.

title: Acquiring multidisciplinary skills for expanding career opportunities is important, say experts
content: The speakers were speaking at a webinar on “Beyond Boundaries: How Multidisciplinary Learning Prepares for a Complex World”, organised jointly by the SRM Institute of Science and Technology and The Hindu.

title: Tamil Nadu told to surrender super-speciality medical seats to AIQ counselling; move draws flak
content: The Tamil Nadu Medical Officers Association has said this goes against the 50% reservation for in-service candidates

title: India’s population reaches 146.39 crore, fertility rate drops below replacement level: UN report
content: The population is expected to grow to 170 crore before starting to dip in about 40 years, the report titled “State of the World Population 2025: The Real Fertility Crisis” says.

title: DGCA to conduct radio communication exam for pilots from November
content: In the past, the examination has been plagued by malpractices and arbitrariness, forcing many to either pay hefty bribes or take the exam overseas

title: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy meets Rahul Gandhi, portfolio reshuffle likely in the Cabinet
content: The Congress high command appears keen on ensuring that the allocation of portfolios aligns not just with governance priorities but also with political aspects in the wake of Congress party’s push for greater representation of downtrodden sections, party sources said

title: Stalin inaugurates libraries at bus termini, hospitals in Vellore, two other districts
content: The CM virtually launched the facilities set up at public spaces with high footfalls in the districts, including Ranipet, Tirupattur; they will function from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. on all days, except Fridays

title: Won’t tolerate abuse of visas, violation of law, says U.S. Embassy
content: The remarks came a day after a video shared online showed an Indian student being restrained by security personnel at the Newark Liberty International Airport

title: No fire at Sakshi office in Eluru, say police
content: A furniture godown was damaged in fire and a case has been registered based on a complaint lodged by the store owner, says DSP

title: COVID cases on the rise in Kerala
content: Health Minister Veena George chairs a meeting of the State Rapid Response Team for tackling the COVID-19 spread in Kerala

title: Caste data set to be re-enumerated in Karnataka to address concerns of some communities
content: Some caste groups, Veerashaivas and Lingayats most vociferously, have been demanding a re-enumeration, claiming that the old one was ‘unscientific’
